result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin Marie Peterson

defendant.name: Peterson, Erin Marie
defendant.address: Party Address Sealed by Judge Jorgenson

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Party Address Sealed by Judge Jorgenson
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.

1:26 PM 
Defendant Erin Marie Peterson in court.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Erin Marie Peterson.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint formal reading was waived.
Court verbally reviews charges/penalties for the record.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Court informs the defendant of her right to counsel.
Defendant is provided with PD phone number and petition for court appointed counsel. 

Court Orders: $2,000.00 Signature Bond
-NO alcohol or controlled substances

Attorney Witt  informs the court his client wishes to waive her right to preliminary hearing.
Court informs the defendant of her right to preliminary hearing and purpose of said hearing.
Court questions defendant re: her right to preliminary hearing.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court questions counsel re: his clients waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds waiver of preliminary is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily.
Court accepts waiver and orders bind over. 

State files information.
Formal reading waived.

Defendant enters plea "NOT GUILTY".
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
